ETYMOLOGY: A blend of "cyber-" (from cybernetics) and "space". Coined by the author William Gibson in his 1982 short story "Burning Chrome" and popularized in his 1984 novel "Neuromancer".

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The notional environment in which communication over computer networks occurs; the global network of interdependent information technology infrastructures, including the Internet, telecommunications networks, and computer systems.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 计算机网络中进行通信的虚拟环境；指由互联网、电信网络和计算机系统等相互依存的信息技术基础设施构成的全球网络空间。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many people now spend a significant portion of their day interacting with others in cyberspace.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 很多人现在每天都在网络空间中与他人进行大量互动。
